1.name: Krakow technical university offers free training courses in basic modern machine and construction Tools
The AVA radio company continue researching electromechanical computers

35.name: Clashes between Poles and Nazi aligned Germans intensify in the Free city of Danzig

70.name: Hitler violates treaty of Versailles, re-militarizing the Rhineland. The threat of war is aparent

355.name: The AVA company starts building a large demonstration electro-mechanical computer

721.name: The AVA company starts selling its mechanical computer to industry and university, significantly boosting all research efforts

105.name: Civilian industry expansion have been funded under the "Central Region industrial strategy"

164.name: The machine tool training increases productivity
The Sejm funds research into new industrial strategy for military production

200.name: Nazi-owned steelwork in Danzig seized by Polish industrialists

217.name: The Construction training has significantly aided the construction sector
Krakow Technical university expands scholarship program for construction workers

245.name: In response to German Mefo bills, Polish industrialists and citizens contribute to National Defence fund
Farmers protest over food-prizes, the authoritarian government, and lack of rural investment

273.name: First stage of industrial strategy increase military production

279.name: Kazimir Sosnkowski appointed chief of the Polish army, tasked with drawing up 2 year rearmament program

110.name: Funding approved for light tank prototype at PZinz institute

300.name: After negotiations with protesters, former PM and April Constitution author Walery Sławek proposes Agrarian and constitutional reform

315.name: President Mościcki concedes to protesters, reforms are passed, strikes are called of

364.name: Adolf Hitler invites Poland to sign Anti-Comintern pact, Mościcki rejects

365.name: Improved Construction training, and the ongoing Agrarian reform has boosted the construction sector further

377.name: Ambitious 1937 stage of the industrial strategy starts, focusing on reorganized industry and use of new advanced machine tools in production

385.name: Sławek's constitutional reform passed with the help of left-wing faction of the Sanation government
President Ignacy Mościcki attempts to undermine Sławek's growing power by allying with general, war-hero, and rival to Sławek: Edward Rydz-Śmigły
In order to subvert Nazi control, the Sanation left covertly funds SPD campaign in Free city of Danzig

420.name: President Ignacy Mościcki pushes for drastically increased army budget, officially to counter Hitler

430.name: Labour unions in the Free City of Danzig increasingly cooperate with the Polish Sanation left, rather than the NSDAP

455.name: President Mościcki announces initiative to centralize power further
The Sejm votes in Sławek ally Joséf Haller as re-armaments minister

305.name: The TKS Recon tankette enters serial production, work on a proper light tank continues

490.name: SPD defeats NSDAP in mayoral election in Free city of Danizg, announces plan to unify with Poland

560.name: The Free City of Danizg is officially dissolved, in major win for Sanation Left
Power struggle between Sławek, Mościcki and Rydz-Śmigły intensify

564.name: Japan invades China,  Rydz-Śmigły delivers a speak warning about imminent war, Sławek applaud his rival

575.name: Rydz-Śmigły and Sławek  agree to set asside their difference to prepare for war

574.name: Second stage of industrial strategy has significantly boosted production capacity, attention is now focused on making railway transport more survivable in the face of air-attack

547.name: Under reform program, the Sanation left and unions start improving manufacturing workers' conditions

735.name: Rydz-Śmigły backs Sławek as prime minister (in a move weakening Mościcki's power and strengthening the Sejm), in a speech Sławek calls for the need for reconciliation and alliance with the Baltic states
Falangists strongly oppose Sławek's reform, government cracks down on them citing adjacency to fascism, while Rydz-Śmigły tries to negotiate with them
Veteran soldier (and outspoken leftist) Kazimierz Switalski appointed commander of special forces

812.name: Anti-Fascist crackdowns end, as falangist leaders agree to support the armament and recruitment effort

595.name: President Mościcki appoints Rydz-Śmigły as Marshall of Poland, Sławek attends the ceremony despite protestation from the left and the other Pilsudski's Colonels

630.name: The sanation left grows stronger in the Sejm, Sławek strengthens his hold over this faction

665.name: Rydz-Śmigły ally with Falangist paramilitaries to bolster military recruitment
Rydz-Śmigły and Sławek talk with President Mościcki about the need to work together, and for the minor Eastern European nations to ally.

465.name: The PZInż 7TP light tank enters serial production, and research improves artillery techniques

634.name: Sosnkowski and Rydz-Śmigły start program to widely implement Anti-Tank riffles and radio training in the army

601.name: Investment in improved machine tools improves productivity
Artillery research funded through tank program

705.name: Funding approved for Military Intelligence agency

734.name: The army orders first armoured trains

770.name: Sławek passes Common Organization of Society, undermining the BBWR

825.name: Vetting and recruiting German socialists and liberals as agents

805.name: A new parliamentarian constitutions takes effect, free and fair elections scheduled for September 1938
With the German invasion of Austria imminent, Benes, Smetona, Ulmanis, and Päts attend conference with Rydz-Śmigły, Sławek, and Mościcki in Vilnius
Expanded training in machine-gun and motors start

779.name: During conference, Austria is annexed by Hitler, Benes ask for security guarantees against Germany, Poland immediately accepts

828.name: Radio operators are integrated at the battalion level, the process of lower-level integration accelerates

875.name: Poland agrees on referendum on return of Vilnius to Lithuania within 2 years, the Polish, Czechoslovak, Lithuanian, Latvian, and Estonian delegations draft mutual defence agreement against Bolshevik and Nazi aggression, diplomatic feelers are extended to Romania

870.name: The Polish army signs contract for new semiautomatic riffles and submachine guns

906.name: Design work on new field-howitzer/self-propelled gun enters prototype stage

945.name: The Vilnius pact is signed, Hitler is furious, the 4 countries agree to merge their intelligence agencies

920.name: The sudeten crisis intensifies, Britain and France backs down

965.name: The national defence fund has been completely spent, the Polish economy starts to buckle under the pressure of rearmament

970.name: Sławek's social-democratic block wins comfortable majority in election, though the pacifist-socialist coalition comes in second
The polish ambassadors to France and the UK lobbies against Deladier and Chamberlain's appeasement

982.name: The treacherous westerners meet with Hitler and Musolini in München, and back Hitlers claims to the Suddetenland
The Czech, Polish, Estonian, Romanian, Latvian and Lithuanian armies mobilize, Rydz-Śmigły appointed supreme commander by all governments

984.name: The Vilnius pact issues warning to Hitler not to invade Czechoslovakia

988.name: Hitler invades Czechoslovakia, Benes calls to arms, Poland answers
